name: Sweet Crunch Winter Salad
description: When fresh vegetables are in short supply, make this Sweet Crunch Winter Salad packed full of winter vegetables and a homemade Maple Tahini Dressing.
recipeIngredient: 3 cups finely chopped broccoli (1 large crown, .75 lbs) ($1.13)

recipeInstructions.text: To prepare the dressing, combine the tahini, water, lemon juice, maple syrup, salt, garlic powder, and cayenne in a bowl or jar. Whisk the ingredients together, or place a lid on your jar and shake until incorporated. Set the dressing aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To prepare the dressing, combine the tahini, water, lemon juice, maple syrup, salt, garlic powder, and cayenne in a bowl or jar. Whisk the ingredients together, or place a lid on your jar and shake until incorporated. Set the dressing aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the cabbage and broccoli, then place them in a bowl. Peel and shred the carrot and slice the green onions. Add the carrots, green onion, sunflower seeds, and dried cranberries to the bowl with the cabbage and broccoli. Stir until everything is evenly combined. This mixture can be refrigerated for 4-5 days, undressed.
recipeInstructions.name: Finely chop the cabbage and broccoli, then place them in a bowl. Peel and shred the carrot and slice the green onions. Add the carrots, green onion, sunflower seeds, and dried cranberries to the bowl with the cabbage and broccoli. Stir until everything is evenly combined. This mixture can be refrigerated for 4-5 days, undressed.

recipeInstructions.text: To serve, drizzle the dressing over the salad mixture and then stir until everything is well coated. You want to use a generous amount of dressing, making sure everything is liberally coated, similar to a coleslaw.
recipeInstructions.name: To serve, drizzle the dressing over the salad mixture and then stir until everything is well coated. You want to use a generous amount of dressing, making sure everything is liberally coated, similar to a coleslaw.

review.reviewBody: I made this tonight and loved it!  The crunch is fantastic.  I had to buy tahini for the first time.  Very interestingâ€¦in a good way ðŸ˜‹

I added a can of chickpeas to bulk up the protein, but oh my goodness this is yummy. 

Here are some high points:Â 

- The dressing is out of this world good! Â Nutty and sweet with a hint of tang from the lemon.
- Maybe took me 10 minutes to throw together. If youâ€™re looking for a fast meal prep recipe, this is it.Â 
- This recipe is almost all vegan staples so youâ€™re not buying stuff youâ€™ll never use again. Higher ticket items like sunflower seeds, maple syrup, dried cranberries, and tahini are always in my cupboard as I use them for a variety of meals. I only had to buy the fresh veggies.
- Red cabbage, carrot, and broccoli really hold up well in the fridge with dressing on. I put dressing on two days ago and everything is still crunchy.Â 
- You feel good after eating this! I have so much energy!
- Donâ€™t leave out green onion! It really adds flavor.

Thanks for the great recipe. Iâ€™m really enjoying it and am adding it to my lunch rotation :)
Great winter slaw and a fresh, crunchy side to our holiday ham

Everything I've made from this site (and I've made a lot) has been delicious and this is no exception!  It seems indulgent somehow even though it's super healthy.  Food for days in only 15 minutes. Thanks again!!

I used to hate salads because they tasted so dull, but wow, this one is SO tasty. My partner and I have eaten this for lunch for two weeks so far. Personally, I prefer it without the cranberries, but my partner loves them included. It's a lot of chopping, but so worth it when you have lunch sorted for a week.

added some spinach and some toasted spiced chickpeas to bulk it up a bit, and I used walnuts instead of sunflower seeds since itâ€™s what I had on hand. Iâ€™m looking forward to having this all week for lunch. Thank you!
My tahini dressing turned out super watery! ðŸ˜© should I add more tahini to thicken it? It tastes great but the texture is all wrongÂ
I made this because I had a ton of cabbage leftover from another recipe - it's delicious - great texture and flavor and so easy to make.  I'm definitely making this a go-to salad
WoW this is delicious. I subbed walnuts for the sunflower seeds because at the store they came in a pre-packaged mix with dried cranberries, and it was so yummy
